paper.title: Back and Forth between Theory and Application : Shared Phonological Coding Between ASL Signbank and ASL-LEXASL Signbank and ASL-LEX
paper.abstract: The development of signed language lexical databases, digital organizations that describe different phonological features of and attempt to establish relationships between signs has resulted in a renewed interest in the phonological descriptions used to uniquely identify and organize the lexicons of respective sign languages (van der Kooij, 2002 ; Fenlon et al., 2016 ; Brentari et al., 2018). Throughout the mutually shared coding process involved in organizing two lexical databases, ASL Signbank (Hochgesang, Crasborn and Lillo-Martin, 2020) and ASL-LEX (Caselli et al., 2016), issues have arisen that require revisiting how phonological features and categories are to be applied and even decided upon, and which would adequately distinguish lexical contrast for respective sign languages. The paper concludes by exploring the inverse of the theory-to-database relationship. Examples are given of theoretical implications and research questions that arise from consequences of language resource building. These are presented as evidence that not only does theory impact organization of databases but that the process of database creation can also inform our theories.

paper.abstract_ar: أدى تطوير قواعد البيانات المعجمية للغة الإشارة ، والمنظمات الرقمية التي تصف السمات الصوتية المختلفة ومحاولة إقامة علاقات بين العلامات ، إلى تجديد الاهتمام بالأوصاف الصوتية المستخدمة لتحديد وتنظيم معاجم لغات الإشارة المعنية بشكل فريد (فان دير كويج ، 2002 ؛ Fenlon et al. ، 2016 ؛ Brentari et al. ، 2018). خلال عملية الترميز المشتركة المشتركة في تنظيم قاعدتي بيانات معجميتين ، ASL Signbank (Hochgesang ، Crasborn و Lillo-Martin ، 2020) و ASL-LEX (Caselli et al. ، 2016) ، ظهرت مشكلات تتطلب إعادة النظر في كيفية الميزات والفئات الصوتية يتم تطبيقها وحتى اتخاذ قرار بشأنها ، والتي من شأنها أن تميز بشكل مناسب التباين المعجمي للغات الإشارة المعنية. تختتم الورقة باستكشاف معكوس العلاقة بين النظرية وقاعدة البيانات. يتم إعطاء أمثلة على الآثار النظرية وأسئلة البحث التي تنشأ من عواقب بناء الموارد اللغوية. يتم تقديم هذه كدليل على أن النظرية لا تؤثر فقط على تنظيم قواعد البيانات ولكن يمكن لعملية إنشاء قاعدة البيانات أيضًا أن تعلم نظرياتنا.
paper.abstract_pt: O desenvolvimento de bancos de dados lexicais de línguas de sinais, organizações digitais que descrevem diferentes características fonológicas e tentam estabelecer relações entre sinais resultou em um interesse renovado nas descrições fonológicas usadas para identificar e organizar de forma única os léxicos das respectivas línguas de sinais (van der Kooij, 2002; Fenlon et al., 2016; Brentari et al., 2018). Ao longo do processo de codificação mutuamente compartilhado envolvido na organização de dois bancos de dados lexicais, ASL Signbank (Hochgesang, Crasborn e Lillo-Martin, 2020) e ASL-LEX (Caselli et al., 2016), surgiram questões que exigem revisitar como características e categorias fonológicas devem ser aplicadas e até decididas, e que distinguiriam adequadamente o contraste lexical para as respectivas línguas de sinais. O artigo conclui explorando o inverso da relação teoria-banco de dados. São dados exemplos de implicações teóricas e questões de pesquisa que surgem das consequências da construção de recursos linguísticos. Estes são apresentados como evidência de que não apenas a teoria impacta a organização de bancos de dados, mas que o processo de criação de banco de dados também pode informar nossas teorias.
paper.abstract_es: El desarrollo de bases de datos léxicas en lenguaje de señas, organizaciones digitales que describen diferentes características fonológicas e intentan establecer relaciones entre los signos, ha dado lugar a un renovado interés en las descripciones fonológicas utilizadas para identificar y organizar de manera única los léxicos de los respectivos lenguajes de signos (van der Kooij, 2002; Fenlon et al., 2016; Brentari et al., 2018). A lo largo del proceso de codificación mutuamente compartido que implica la organización de dos bases de datos léxicas, ASL Signbank (Hochgesang, Crasborn y Lillo-Martin, 2020) y ASL-LEX (Caselli et al., 2016), han surgido problemas que requieren revisar cómo deben aplicarse e incluso decidirse las características fonológicas y las categorías. y que permita distinguir adecuadamente el contraste léxico de las respectivas lenguas de signos. El artículo concluye explorando la inversa de la relación entre la teoría y la base de datos. Se dan ejemplos de implicaciones teóricas y preguntas de investigación que surgen de las consecuencias de la creación de recursos lingüísticos. Estos se presentan como evidencia de que no solo la teoría impacta en la organización de las bases de datos, sino que el proceso de creación de la base de datos también puede informar nuestras teorías.
paper.abstract_ja: 署名言語の語彙データベースの開発は、さまざまな音声学的特徴を記述し、記号間の関係を確立しようとするデジタル組織であり、それぞれの手話の語彙を一意に識別し、整理するために使用される音声学的記述への新たな関心をもたらした（ van der Kooij, 2002; Fenlon et al., 2016; Brentari et al., 2018 ）。 ASL Signbank （ Hochgesang, Crasborn and Lillo - Martin, 2020 ）とASL - LEX （ Caselli et al., 2016 ）の2つの語彙データベースの整理に関わる相互共有のコーディングプロセスを通じて、音声学的特徴とカテゴリがどのように適用され、さらには決定されるかを再検討する必要がある問題が発生しており、それぞれの手話の語彙的コントラストを適切に区別することができます。 理論とデータベースの関係の逆数を探ることで論文は終わる。 言語リソース構築の結果から生じる理論的な意味合いと研究上の疑問の例を挙げる。 これらは、理論がデータベースの組織化に影響を与えるだけでなく、データベースの作成プロセスが私たちの理論にも影響を与えることができる証拠として提示されています。

paper.abstract_hi: हस्ताक्षरित भाषा लेक्सिकल डेटाबेस, डिजिटल संगठनों के विकास के लिए जो विभिन्न ध्वन्यात्मक विशेषताओं का वर्णन करते हैं और संकेतों के बीच संबंधों को स्थापित करने का प्रयास करते हैं, के परिणामस्वरूप संबंधित साइन लैंग्वेज (वैन डेर कुइज, 2002) के शब्दकोशों को विशिष्ट रूप से पहचानने और व्यवस्थित करने के लिए उपयोग किए जाने वाले ध्वन्यात्मक विवरणों में नए सिरे से रुचि हुई है; Fenlon et al., 2016; ब्रेंटारी एट अल., 2018)। दो लेक्सिकल डेटाबेस, एएसएल साइनबैंक (होकजेसांग, क्रैसबॉर्न और लिलो-मार्टिन, 2020) और एएसएल-एलईएक्स (कैसली एट अल। पेपर सिद्धांत-से-डेटाबेस संबंध के व्युत्क्रम की खोज करके समाप्त होता है। उदाहरण सैद्धांतिक निहितार्थ और अनुसंधान प्रश्नों के दिए गए हैं जो भाषा संसाधन निर्माण के परिणामों से उत्पन्न होते हैं। इन्हें सबूत के रूप में प्रस्तुत किया जाता है कि न केवल सिद्धांत डेटाबेस के संगठन को प्रभावित करता है, बल्कि डेटाबेस निर्माण की प्रक्रिया भी हमारे सिद्धांतों को सूचित कर सकती है।
paper.abstract_ga: Mar gheall ar fhorbairt bhunachair shonraí foclóireachta teanga chomharthaíochta, eagraíochtaí digiteacha a dhéanann cur síos ar ghnéithe éagsúla fóineolaíochta de chomharthaí agus a dhéanann iarracht caidreamh a bhunú idir comharthaí tá spéis athnuaite sna tuairiscí fóineolaíochta a úsáidtear chun foclóirí na dteangacha comharthaíochta faoi seach a aithint agus a eagrú go huathúil (van der Kooij, 2002; Fenlon et al., 2016; Brentari et al., 2018). Le linn an phróisis códaithe comhroinnte a bhfuil baint aige le dhá bhunachar sonraí foclóireachta a eagrú, ASL Signbank (Hochgesang, Crasborn agus Lillo-Martin, 2020) agus ASL-LEX (Caselli et al., 2016), tá saincheisteanna tagtha chun cinn a éilíonn athbhreithniú a dhéanamh arís ar na gnéithe agus na catagóirí fóineolaíochta. le cur i bhfeidhm agus fiú cinneadh a dhéanamh orthu, agus a dhéanfadh idirdhealú leordhóthanach idir codarsnacht léacsach do theangacha comharthaíochta faoi seach. Críochnaíonn an páipéar trí iniúchadh a dhéanamh ar inbhéartach an chaidrimh idir teoiric agus bunachar sonraí. Tugtar samplaí d’impleachtaí teoiriciúla agus de cheisteanna taighde a eascraíonn as iarmhairtí a bhaineann le tógáil acmhainní teanga. Cuirtear iad seo i láthair mar fhianaise ní hamháin go mbíonn tionchar ag teoiric ar eagrú bunachair shonraí ach gur féidir leis an bpróiseas cruthaithe bunachar sonraí ár gcuid teoiricí a threorú freisin.
paper.abstract_ka: დაწერტილი ენის ლექსიკალური მონაცემების განვითარება, დიზიტალური ორგანიზაციები, რომლებიც განსხვავებული ფონოლოგიური ფონოლოგიური ფონოლოგიური ფონოლოგიური ფონოლოგიური ფონოლოგიური შესახებების განვითარება და ორგანიზაციაში გამოყენებული ფონოლოგიური განსახებ ერთადერთად გაყოფილი კოდინო პროცესი, რომელიც ორი ლექსიკალური მონაცემების ორგანიზაციაში დაკავშირებულია, ASL Signbank (Hochgesang, Crasborn და Lillo-Martin, 2020) და ASL-LEX (Caselli et al., 2016) და ASL-LEX (Caselli et al., 2016) პროცესი გახდა, რომელიც უნდა გამოყენება ფონოლოგიური ფონოლოგიური ფონო გვერდის გადასრულება ტეორია-დან დაბაზების შესახებ შესახებ. მაგალითები ტეორეტიკური ინფლიქციების და სწავლობის კითხვების შემდეგ, რომლებიც ენის რესურსების შემდეგ იქნება. ეს იქნება, როგორც წარმოიდგინეთ, რომ ტეორია არა მხოლოდ მონაცემების ორგანიზაციას, მაგრამ რომ ბაზის შექმნა პროცესი შეუძლია ჩვენი თეორიაების ინფორმაცი
paper.abstract_el: Η ανάπτυξη λεξικών βάσεων δεδομένων υπογεγραμμένης γλώσσας, ψηφιακών οργανισμών που περιγράφουν διαφορετικά φωνολογικά χαρακτηριστικά και επιχειρούν να δημιουργήσουν σχέσεις μεταξύ των σημαδιών έχει ως αποτέλεσμα ένα νέο ενδιαφέρον για τις φωνολογικές περιγραφές που χρησιμοποιούνται για τον μοναδικό προσδιορισμό και την οργάνωση των λεξικών των αντίστοιχων νοηματικών γλωσσών (Βαν ντερ Κούι, 2002, Φένλον κ.α., 2016, Μπρέντρι κ.α., 2018). Κατά τη διάρκεια της αμοιβαία κοινής διαδικασίας κωδικοποίησης που περιλαμβάνει την οργάνωση δύο λεξικών βάσεων δεδομένων, ASL Signbank (Hochgesang, Crasborn και Lillo-Martin, 2020) και ASL-LEX (Caselli et al., 2016), έχουν προκύψει ζητήματα που απαιτούν επανεξέταση του τρόπου εφαρμογής και ακόμη και απόφασης φωνολογικών χαρακτηριστικών και κατηγοριών, και τα οποία θα μπορούσαν να διακρίνουν επαρκώς τη λεξική αντίθεση για τις αντίστοιχες νοηματικές γλώσσες. Η εργασία ολοκληρώνεται διερευνώντας το αντίστροφο της σχέσης θεωρίας-βάσης δεδομένων. Παραδείγματα θεωρητικών επιπτώσεων και ερευνητικών ερωτήσεων που προκύπτουν από τις συνέπειες της δημιουργίας γλωσσικών πόρων. Αυτά παρουσιάζονται ως αποδεικτικά στοιχεία ότι όχι μόνο η θεωρία επηρεάζει την οργάνωση των βάσεων δεδομένων αλλά και ότι η διαδικασία δημιουργίας βάσεων δεδομένων μπορεί επίσης να ενημερώσει τις θεωρίες μας.
paper.abstract_hu: A jelek különböző fonológiai tulajdonságait leíró, digitális szervezetek fejlesztése és a jelek közötti kapcsolatok kialakítására irányuló fonológiai leírások iránti megújult érdeklődést eredményezett (van der Kooij, 2002; Fenlon et al., 2016; Brentari et al., 2018). Az ASL Signbank (Hochgesang, Crasborn és Lillo-Martin, 2020) és ASL-LEX (Caselli et al., 2016) kölcsönösen megosztott kódolási folyamat során olyan kérdések merültek fel, amelyek szükségessé teszik a fonológiai jellemzők és kategóriák alkalmazásának és alkalmazásának felülvizsgálatát, sőt még döntést is, és amelyek megfelelően megkülönböztetik a lexikális kontrasztot az adott jelnyelven. A tanulmány az elmélet-adatbázis kapcsolat fordításával zárul. Példákat adunk a nyelvi erőforrás-építés következményeiből fakadó elméleti vonatkozásokra és kutatási kérdésekre. Ezeket bizonyítékként mutatjuk be, hogy az elmélet nemcsak hatással van az adatbázisok szervezésére, hanem hogy az adatbázis létrehozásának folyamata is tájékoztatja elméleteinket.
paper.abstract_it: Lo sviluppo di banche dati lessicali del linguaggio dei segni, organizzazioni digitali che descrivono le diverse caratteristiche fonologiche e tentano di stabilire relazioni tra segni, ha portato ad un rinnovato interesse per le descrizioni fonologiche utilizzate per identificare e organizzare in modo univoco i lessici dei rispettivi linguaggi dei segni (van der Kooij, 2002; Fenlon et al., 2016; Brentari et al., 2018). Nel corso del processo di codifica condiviso che ha coinvolto l'organizzazione di due database lessicali, ASL Signbank (Hochgesang, Crasborn e Lillo-Martin, 2020) e ASL-LEX (Caselli et al., 2016), sono emerse questioni che richiedono una rivisitazione del modo in cui le caratteristiche fonologiche e le categorie devono essere applicate e persino decise, e che potrebbero distinguere adeguatamente il contrasto lessicale per i rispettivi linguaggi dei segni. L'articolo conclude esplorando l'inverso della relazione teoria-database. Vengono forniti esempi di implicazioni teoriche e domande di ricerca che derivano dalle conseguenze della costruzione delle risorse linguistiche. Questi sono presentati come prova che non solo la teoria influisce sull'organizzazione dei database, ma che il processo di creazione di database può anche informare le nostre teorie.
paper.abstract_kk: Қолтаңбаланған тіл лексикалық деректер қорларының, цифрлық құрылғыларының түрлі фонологиялық мүмкіндіктерін таңдап, белгілер арасындағы қатынастарын құру әрекеттерінің қасиеттерін бірге анықтау және реттеу үшін қолданылатын фонологиялық түрлерінің қасиеттерінің қасиеттерін жаңартуы жасады. Екі лексикалық деректер қорын құрастыру үшін, ASL Signbank (Hochgesang, Crasborn және Lillo-Martin, 2020) және ASL-LEX (Caselli et al., 2016) және ASL-LEX (Caselli et al., 2016) бағдарламалардың біріктірілген кодтамасы бойынша, фонологиялық мүмкіндіктерді және санаттарын қалай қолдану керек екенін қайталау керек, сондай-ақ Қағаз теория мен деректер қорының қатынасының керісін зерттеп жатыр. paper.abstract_lt: Pasirašytų kalbų leksinių duomenų bazių, skaitmeninių organizacijų, kuriose apibūdinami skirtingi fonologiniai požymiai ir bandomi užmegzti ryšius tarp ženklų, kūrimas atnaujino susidomėjimą fonologiniais aprašais, naudojamais unikaliai identifikuoti ir organizuoti atitinkamų ženklų kalbų leksikonus (van der Kooij, 2002; Fenlon et al., 2016; Brentari et al., 2018). Per tarpusavyje bendras kodavimo procesas, susijęs su dviejų leksinių duomenų bazių organizavimu, ASL Signbank (Hochgesang, Crasborn ir Lillo-Martin, 2020) ir ASL-LEX (Caselli et al., 2016), kilo problemų, dėl kurių reikia persvarstyti, kaip fonologinės savybės ir kategorijos turi būti taikomos ir net nuspręsti, ir kurios tinkamai atskirtų atitinkamų ženklų kalbų tekstinį kontrastą. Dokumentas baigiamas tiriant teorijos ir duomenų bazės santykius atvirkščiai. Pateikiami teorinių pasekmių ir mokslinių tyrimų klausimų, kylančių dėl kalbų išteklių kūrimo pasekmių, pavyzdžiai. Jie pateikiami kaip įrodymai, kad ne tik teorinė duomenų bazių organizacija daro poveikį, bet ir duomenų bazių kūrimo procesas gali informuoti mūsų teorijas.
paper.abstract_mt: L-iżvilupp ta’ bażijiet tad-dejta lexikali tal-lingwa ffirmati, organizzazzjonijiet diġitali li jiddeskrivu karatteristiċi fonoloġiċi differenti ta’ u jippruvaw jistabbilixxu relazzjonijiet bejn is-sinjali wassal għal interess imġedded fid-deskrizzjonijiet fonoloġiċi użati biex jidentifikaw u jorganizzaw b’mod uniku l-lexikoni tal-lingwi tas-sinjali rispettivi (van der Kooij, 2002; Fenlon et al., 2016; Brentari et al., 2018). Matul il-proċess ta’ kodifikazzjoni kondiviż reċiprokament involut fl-organizzazzjoni ta’ żewġ bażijiet ta’ dejta lexiċi, ASL Signbank (Hochgesang, Crasborn u Lillo-Martin, 2020) u ASL-LEX (Caselli et al., 2016), tqajmu kwistjonijiet li jeħtieġu reviżjoni ta’ kif għandhom jiġu applikati l-karatteristiċi fonoloġiċi u l-kategoriji u anke deċiżi dwarhom, u li jiddistingwu b’mod adegwat il-kuntrast lexiku għal-lingwi rispettivi tas-sinjali. paper.abstract_mk: Развојот на потпишаните лексикални бази на податоци на јазикот, дигиталните организации кои опишуваат различни фонолошки карактеристики на и се обидуваат да воспостават врски помеѓу знаците резултираше со обновен интерес за фонолошките описи кои се користат за единствено идентификување и организација на лексиконите на одговорните јазици на знаците (van der Kooij Во текот на заедничкиот процес на кодирање вклучен во организацијата на две лексикални бази на податоци, АСЛ Синџебанк (Хохгесанг, Красборн и Лило-Мартин, 2020) и АСЛ-ЛЕКС (Касели и други, 2016), се појавија прашања кои бараат ревидирање на тоа како ќе се применат и дури ќе се одлучат фонолошките карактеристики и категории, и кои ќе го разликуваат ле Документот завршува со истражување на спротивната врска на теоријата со базата на податоци. Подаваат примери за теоретски импликации и истражувачки прашања кои се појавуваат од последиците од изградбата на јазички ресурси. Овие се претставени како докази дека не само теоријата влијае на организацијата на базите на податоци, туку и дека процесот на создавање на бази на податоци може да ги информира нашите теории.
paper.abstract_ms: Pembangunan pangkalan data leksikal bahasa yang ditandatangani, organisasi digital yang menggambarkan ciri-ciri fonologi berbeza dan cuba untuk menetapkan hubungan antara tanda telah menyebabkan kepentingan berulang dalam deskripsi fonologi yang digunakan untuk mengenalpasti dan mengatur leksikon bahasa tanda yang sesuai (van der Kooij, 2002; Fenlon et al., 2016; Brentari et al., 2018). Sepanjang proses pengekodan berkongsi antara satu sama lain yang terlibat dalam mengatur dua pangkalan data leksikal, ASL Signbank (Hochgesang, Crasborn dan Lillo-Martin, 2020) dan ASL-LEX (Caselli et al., 2016), ada isu yang memerlukan mengulang bagaimana ciri-ciri fonologi dan kategori akan dilaksanakan dan bahkan memutuskan, dan yang akan membedakan perbezaan leksikal untuk bahasa tanda yang sesuai. Kertas ini berakhir dengan mengeksplorasi sebaliknya hubungan teori-ke-pangkalan data. Contoh diberi implikasi teori dan soalan kajian yang muncul dari konsekuensi pembangunan sumber bahasa. Ini dipaparkan sebagai bukti yang tidak hanya mempengaruhi teori organisasi pangkalan data tetapi bahawa proses penciptaan pangkalan data juga boleh memberitahu teori kita.

paper.abstract_no: Utviklinga av signerte språk- leksiske databaser, digitale organisasjonar som beskriver ulike fonologiske funksjonar av og prøver å oppretta forholdet mellom tegn har ført til å gjenoppretta interesse i dei fonologiske skildringane som er brukte for å unikevel identifisera og organisera leksikonsane av tilhøyrande signspråk (van der Kooij, 2002; Fenlon et al., 2016; Brentari et al., 2018). Gjennom den samme delte kodingsprosessen som er involvert i å organisera to leksiske databaser, ASL Signbank (Hochgesang, Crasborn og Lillo-Martin, 2020) og ASL-LEX (Caselli et al., 2016), har oppstått problemer som krev å gjenoppretta korleis fonologiske funksjonar og kategoriar skal brukast og til og med avgjørast, og som vil tilsvarande forskjellige leksiske kontrast for tilhøyrande teiknspråk. Papiret avsluttar ved å utforska omvendt av teorieforhold til databasen. Eksempel er gitt av teoretiske implikasjonar og forskningsspørsmål som oppstår frå konsekvensar av språkkressursbygging. Dette er presentert som bevis at teorien ikkje bare påvirkar databaseorganisasjonen, men at prosessen for databaseoppretting kan også informera teorien våre.
paper.abstract_pl: Rozwój baz leksykalnych języków migowych, organizacji cyfrowych opisujących różne cechy fonologiczne języka migowego i próbujących nawiązać relacje między znakami spowodował ponowne zainteresowanie opisami fonologicznymi używanymi do unikalnej identyfikacji i organizacji leksykonów poszczególnych języków migowych (van der Kooij, 2002; Fenlon et al., 2016; Brentari et al., 2018). W trakcie wzajemnie wspólnego procesu kodowania związanego z organizowaniem dwóch leksykalnych baz danych, ASL Signbank (Hochgesang, Crasborn i Lillo-Martin, 2020) i ASL-LEX (Caselli et al., 2016), pojawiły się problemy, które wymagają ponownego przeanalizowania, w jaki sposób należy stosować cechy fonologiczne i kategorie, a nawet podejmować decyzje, a które odpowiednio odróżniłyby kontrast leksykalny dla poszczególnych języków migowych. Artykuł kończy badaniem odwrotności relacji teoria-baza danych. Podano przykłady teoretycznych implikacji i pytań badawczych wynikających z konsekwencji budowania zasobów językowych. Przedstawione są one jako dowód na to, że nie tylko teoria wpływa na organizację baz danych, ale że proces tworzenia baz danych może również informować nasze teorie.
paper.abstract_ro: Dezvoltarea bazelor de date lexicale cu limbaj semnat, organizații digitale care descriu diferite caracteristici fonologice ale semnelor și încearcă să stabilească relații între semne a dus la reînnoirea interesului pentru descrierile fonologice folosite pentru identificarea și organizarea unică a lexicoanelor limbajelor semnelor respective (van der Kooij, 2002; Fenlon et al., 2016; Brentari et al., 2018). Pe parcursul procesului de codificare comun implicat în organizarea a două baze de date lexicale, ASL Signbank (Hochgesang, Crasborn și Lillo-Martin, 2020) și ASL-LEX (Caselli et al., 2016), au apărut probleme care necesită revizuirea modului în care caracteristicile și categoriile fonologice trebuie aplicate și chiar luate decizii și care ar distinge în mod adecvat contrastul lexical pentru limbile semnelor respective. Lucrarea se încheie prin explorarea inversului relației teoria-baza de date. Sunt oferite exemple de implicații teoretice și întrebări de cercetare care apar din consecințele construirii resurselor lingvistice. Acestea sunt prezentate ca dovadă că nu numai teoria are impact asupra organizării bazelor de date, dar că procesul de creare a bazelor de date poate informa și teoriile noastre.

paper.abstract_sr: Razvoj potpisanih jezičkih leksičkih baza podataka, digitalnih organizacija koji opisuju različite fonološke karakteristike i pokušaja uspostavljanja odnosa između znakova rezultirao je obnovljen interes za fonološke opise koji su koristili za jedinstveno identifikaciju i organizaciju leksikone odgovarajućih jezika znakova (van der Kooij, 2002; Fenlon et al., 2016; Brentari et al., 2018). Kroz međusobno zajednički proces kodiranja uključen u organizaciju dve leksičke baze podataka, ASL Signbank (Hochgesang, Crasborn i Lillo-Martin, 2020) i ASL-LEX (Caselli et al., 2016), došlo je do pitanja koje zahtevaju pregledati kako se primjenjuju fonološke funkcije i kategorije i čak odlučuju, a koje bi odgovarajući razlikuju leksički kontrast za odgovarajuće jezike znaka. Papir zaključuje istraživanjem obrnutog odnosa teorije na bazu podataka. Primjeri su dati teorijske implikacije i pitanja istraživanja koje prouzrokuju posledice izgradnje jezičkih resursa. To je predstavljeno kao dokaz da ne samo teorija utiče na organizaciju baza podataka, nego da proces stvaranja baze podataka takođe može obavijestiti naše teorije.

paper.abstract_sv: Utvecklingen av lexikala databaser för teckenspråk, digitala organisationer som beskriver olika fonologiska drag av och försöker etablera relationer mellan tecken har resulterat i ett förnyat intresse för de fonologiska beskrivningar som används för att unikt identifiera och organisera lexikonerna för respektive teckenspråk (van der Kooij, 2002; Fenlon et al., 2016; Brentari et al., 2018). paper.abstract_ur: نشانیوں کے درمیان رابطہ قائم کرنے کی کوشش کرنے والی زبان لکسیکل ڈاٹ بیس کی توسعہ، ڈیجیٹل سازمانیاں جو مختلف فانولوژیکوں کی تعریف کرتی ہیں اور نشانیوں کے درمیان رابطہ قائم کرنے کی کوشش کرتی ہیں، ان فنولوژیکوں کی توسعہ کے نتیجہ میں ایک ہی طرح پہچان اور سازمان کرنے کے لئے استعمال کئے جاتے ہیں۔ دو لکسیکل ڈیٹابیز کی سازمان میں مشترک مشترک کوڈینگ پروسس کے باوجود ASL سیگن بانک (Hochgesang, Crasborn اور Lillo-Martin, 2020) اور ASL-LEX (Caselli et al., 2016) کے مسئلہ میں مشترک ہو گئے ہیں جن کی تغییر کی ضرورت ہے کہ کس طرح فانولوژیکوں اور کائٹیوں کا استعمال کیا جائے گا اور کس طرح بھی فیصلہ کیا جائے گا، اور جو ان نشانیوں کی زبانوں کے لئے مناسب لکسیکل کن یہ کاغذ فیصلہ کرتا ہے کہ نظریہ سے ڈیٹابیس رابطہ کی مخالفت کی تحقیق کرتی ہے. مثالیں تئوریٹی اثرات اور تحقیق سؤال کے ذریعے بیان کیے جاتے ہیں جو زبان سراسر بنیاد کے نتائج سے آتے ہیں. یہ صرف ڈیٹابیز کے سازمان کی تئوری کے تاثیر نہیں ہے بلکہ ڈیٹابیز بنانے کی پروسس بھی ہماری نظریوں کو بتائے گی۔

paper.abstract_uz: Bogʻlamalar orasidan aloqalarni aniqlash va boshqa fonologik xususiyatlarini anglatadigan tillar uchun imkoniyatlarni yaratish uchun fonologik taʼriflarini yangi qiziqarishga ega beradi. Leksikanlarni aniqlash va boshqarish uchun ishlatiladi (van der Kooij, 2002; Fenlon et, 2016; Brentari et al, 2018). Throughout the mutually shared coding process involved in organizing two lexical databases, ASL Signbank (Hochgesang, Crasborn and Lillo-Martin, 2020) and ASL-LEX (Caselli et al., 2016), issues have arisen that require revisiting how phonological features and categories are to be applied and even decided upon, and which would adequately distinguish lexical contrast for respective sign languages. Qogʻoz teori-to-maʼlumot bazasi bogʻlamasini aniqlashni tugatadi. Masalan, tasavvur qilinadigan teoretikal muammolar va ta'qish savollaridan iborat, bu til resource quyidagi natijalari natijasida sababchi. Ular faqat maʼlumotlar bazasining tashkilotlari tayyorligiga ega emas, balki maʼlumot bazasi yaratish jarayonini va bizning nazarlarimizni aytish mumkin.
paper.abstract_vi: Việc phát triển các cơ sở dữ liệu ngôn ngữ có chữ ký, các tổ chức kỹ thuật số mô tả các đặc điểm âm của và cố gắng thiết lập các mối quan hệ giữa các dấu hiệu đã làm tăng mối quan tâm mới tới các mô tả ngôn ngữ âm thanh được dùng để đặc biệt xác định và tổ chức các từ ngữ ký riêng (Van der Kooij, lảng tránh; Fenlon et al., 206; Brentari et al., 208). Trong suốt quá trình lập trình hai bên được chia sẻ liên quan đến việc tổ chức hai cơ sở dữ liệu từ vựng, ASL Denbank (Hochmagesing, Crasborn and Lillio-Martin, 2020) và ASL-LEX (Caselli et al., phần 6), có những vấn đề cần phải xem lại cách mà các tính chất và phân loại theo gốc được áp dụng và thậm chí quyết định, và sẽ phân biệt tối thiểu sự tương phản xạ từ ngữ cho các ngôn ngữ ký tự. Bài báo kết thúc bằng cách khám phá ngược lại mối quan hệ giả lập với cơ sở dữ liệu. Ví dụ về những tác động lý thuyết và những câu hỏi nghiên cứu nảy sinh từ hậu quả của việc xây dựng tài nguyên ngôn ngữ. Những thứ này được trình bày như một bằng chứng rằng không chỉ tổ chức tác động lý thuyết của cơ sở dữ liệu mà còn có thể cung cấp các giả thuyết của chúng ta.
paper.abstract_bg: Разработването на лексикални бази данни на подписания език, дигитални организации, които описват различни фонологични особености и се опитват да установят взаимоотношения между знаците, доведе до подновен интерес към фонологичните описания, използвани за уникално идентифициране и организиране на лексиконите на съответните езикови знаци (ван дер Коой, 2002; Фенлон и др., 2016; Брентари и др., 2018). По време на взаимно споделения процес на кодиране, свързан с организирането на две лексикални бази данни, са възникнали въпроси, които изискват преразглеждане на начина, по който фонологичните характеристики и категории трябва да бъдат приложени и дори решени, и които биха разграничили адекватно лексикалния контраст за съответните жестови езици. Докладът завършва с изследване на обратната връзка теория-база данни. Дадени са примери за теоретични последици и изследователски въпроси, които възникват от последиците от изграждането на езикови ресурси. Те са представени като доказателство, че не само теорията влияе върху организацията на базите данни, но и че процесът на създаване на бази данни може да информира нашите теории.
paper.abstract_da: Udviklingen af lexikale databaser med tegnsprog, digitale organisationer, der beskriver forskellige fonologiske træk ved og forsøger at etablere relationer mellem tegn, har resulteret i en fornyet interesse for de fonologiske beskrivelser, der anvendes til entydigt at identificere og organisere lexikonerne for de respektive tegnsprog (van der Kooij, 2002; Fenlon et al., 2016; Brentari et al., 2018). Gennem den gensidigt fælles kodningsproces, der involverer organiseringen af to leksikalske databaser, ASL Signbank (Hochgesang, Crasborn og Lillo-Martin, 2020) og ASL-LEX (Caselli et al., 2016), er der opstået problemer, der kræver en revision af, hvordan fonologiske funktioner og kategorier skal anvendes og endda besluttes, og som vil skelne tilstrækkeligt mellem leksikalsk kontrast for de respektive tegnsprog. Artiklen slutter med at undersøge den inverse af teori-til-database forholdet. Der gives eksempler på teoretiske implikationer og forskningsspørgsmål, der opstår af konsekvenserne af sprogressourceopbygning. Disse præsenteres som bevis for, at teorien ikke kun påvirker organiseringen af databaser, men at processen med databaseoprettelse også kan informere vores teorier.
paper.abstract_nl: De ontwikkeling van lexicale databases in gebarentaal, digitale organisaties die verschillende fonologische kenmerken van tekens beschrijven en proberen relaties tussen tekens tot stand te brengen, heeft geresulteerd in een hernieuwde belangstelling voor fonologische beschrijvingen die gebruikt worden om de lexicons van de respectievelijke gebarentalen uniek te identificeren en te ordenen (van der Kooij, 2002; Fenlon et al., 2016; Brentari et al., 2018). Gedurende het onderling gedeelde coderingsproces dat gepaard ging met het organiseren van twee lexicale databases, ASL Signbank (Hochgesang, Crasborn en Lillo-Martin, 2020) en ASL-LEX (Caselli et al., 2016), zijn problemen opgetreden die opnieuw moeten worden bekeken hoe fonologische kenmerken en categorieën moeten worden toegepast en zelfs moeten worden beslist, en die het lexicale contrast voor de respectieve gebarentalen adequaat zouden onderscheiden. Het artikel sluit af met het verkennen van de omgekeerde van de theorie-database relatie. Er worden voorbeelden gegeven van theoretische implicaties en onderzoeksvragen die voortvloeien uit de gevolgen van taalopbouw. Deze worden gepresenteerd als bewijs dat theorie niet alleen invloed heeft op de organisatie van databases, maar dat het proces van databasecreatie ook onze theorieën kan beïnvloeden.
paper.abstract_de: Die Entwicklung von lexikalischen Datenbanken in Gebärdensprache, digitalen Organisationen, die verschiedene phonologische Merkmale von Gebärdensprachen beschreiben und versuchen, Beziehungen zwischen Gebärdensprachen herzustellen, hat zu einem erneuten Interesse an phonologischen Beschreibungen geführt, die verwendet werden, um die Lexika der jeweiligen Gebärdensprachen eindeutig zu identifizieren und zu organisieren (van der Kooij, 2002; Fenlon et al., 2016; Brentari et al., 2018). Während des gemeinsam genutzten Codierungsprozesses bei der Organisation zweier lexikalischer Datenbanken, ASL Signbank (Hochgesang, Crasborn und Lillo-Martin, 2020) und ASL-LEX (Caselli et al., 2016), traten Fragen auf, die es erfordern, die Anwendung und Entscheidung phonologischer Merkmale und Kategorien zu überprüfen und die lexikalischen Kontrast für die jeweiligen Gebärdensprachen adäquat zu unterscheiden. Die Arbeit schließt mit der Untersuchung der Kehrseite der Theorie-Datenbank-Beziehung. Beispiele für theoretische Implikationen und Forschungsfragen, die sich aus den Konsequenzen des Sprachressourcenaufbaus ergeben, werden gegeben. Diese werden als Beweis präsentiert, dass die Theorie nicht nur die Organisation von Datenbanken beeinflusst, sondern dass der Prozess der Datenbankerstellung auch unsere Theorien beeinflussen kann.
paper.abstract_id: Pembangunan pangkalan data lexik bahasa yang ditandatangani, organisasi digital yang menggambarkan karakteristik fonologi yang berbeda dan mencoba untuk mendirikan hubungan antara tanda-tanda telah menyebabkan tertarik ulang pada deskripsi fonologi yang digunakan untuk mengidentifikasi dan mengatur leksikon bahasa-bahasa tanda yang sesuai (van der Kooij, 2002; Fenlon et al., 2016; Brentari et al., 2018). Selama proses kode berbagi antara satu sama lain yang terlibat dalam organisasi dua pangkalan data lexik, ASL Signbank (Hochgesang, Crasborn dan Lillo-Martin, 2020) dan ASL-LEX (Caselli et al., 2016), masalah yang telah muncul yang membutuhkan revisi bagaimana karakteristik fonologi dan kategori akan diaplikasikan dan bahkan memutuskan, dan yang akan membedakan dengan cukup kontras lexik untuk berbagai bahasa tanda. Kertas ini berakhir dengan mengeksplorasi sebaliknya dari hubungan teori-ke-database. Contoh yang diberikan dari implikasi teori dan pertanyaan penelitian yang muncul dari konsekuensi pembangunan sumber daya bahasa. Ini ditunjukkan sebagai bukti bahwa tidak hanya teori mempengaruhi organisasi pangkalan data tetapi bahwa proses penciptaan pangkalan data juga dapat memberitahu teori kita.
paper.abstract_ko: 수화 어휘 데이터베이스, 수화의 서로 다른 음성 특징을 설명하고 수화 간의 관계를 구축하려는 디지털 조직의 발전으로 인해 사람들은 각자의 수화 어휘를 유일하게 식별하고 조직하는 데 사용되는 음성 묘사에 새로운 관심을 가지게 되었다(van der Kooij, 2002, Fenlon et al., 2016, Brentari et al., 2018).두 개의 어휘 데이터베이스인 ASL Signbank(Hochgesang, Crasborn과 Lillo Martin, 2020)와 ASL-LEX(Caselli 등, 2016)를 조직하는 과정에서 음성 특징과 유형이 어떻게 응용되는지, 심지어 어떻게 결정되는지 재검토해야 하는 문제가 발생했다. 이런 문제들은 각자의 수화의 어휘 대비를 충분히 구분할 것이다.본고는 마지막으로 이 이론과 데이터베이스 관계의 반비례를 탐구했다.글에서 예를 들어 언어 자원 건설이 가져온 이론적 의미와 연구 문제를 설명했다.이러한 증거에 의하면 이론은 데이터베이스의 조직에 영향을 미칠 뿐만 아니라 데이터베이스의 창설 과정도 우리의 이론에 정보를 제공할 수 있다.
paper.abstract_fa: توسعه پایگاه‌های داده‌های زبان‌شناسی امضا شده، سازمان‌های دیجیتال که ویژه‌های تلفن‌شناسی مختلف را توصیف می‌کنند و تلاش می‌کنند رابطه‌های بین نشانه‌ها به دلیل تازه‌ای از توصیف‌های تلفن‌شناسی که استفاده می‌شود برای شناسایی و سازمان لکسیون زبان‌های نشانه‌های مختلف (van der Kooij, 2002; در طول فرایند کودینگ با هم مشترک در سازمان دو بنیاد داده‌های زبان‌شناسی ASL Signbank (Hochgesang, Crasborn and Lillo-Martin, 2020) و ASL-LEX (Caselli et al., 2016) مشکلات اتفاق افتاده‌اند که نیاز به تغییر بررسی کردن چگونه ویژه‌های تلفن‌شناسی و کلاسی‌های استفاده می‌شوند و حتی به آن تصمیم می‌گیرند، و که برای زبانهای نشانی‌شناسی به اندازه‌ این کاغذ با تحقیق سرپیچی رابطه‌ی تئوری و داده‌های داده‌ی داده‌ی داده‌های پایان می‌گیرد. مثالها از اثرات نظریه و سوالات تحقیقات که از نتایج ساختن منابع زبان به وجود می آیند به عنوان مثالها داده می شوند. اینها به عنوان مدرک پیشنهاد می‌شوند که نه تنها تئوری بر سازمان داده‌های داده‌ها تأثیر می‌دهد بلکه فرایند ساختن داده‌های داده‌های ما می‌تواند تئوری‌های ما را اطلاع دهد.
paper.abstract_sw: Maendeleo ya databases za lugha za lexico, mashirika ya kidigitali yanayoelezea vipengele tofauti vya simu za viganjani na jaribio la kuanzisha mahusiano kati ya ishara imesababisha maslahi ya upya ya maelezo ya kifolojia yaliyotumiwa kwa ajili ya kutambua na kuandaa lexico ya lugha zenye saini (van der Kooij, 2002; Fenlon et, 2016; Brentari et al, 2018). Kupitia mchakato wa kupiga kura unaohusika na kuandaa databases mbili za lexico, ASL Signbank (Hochgesang, Crasborn na Lillo-Martin, 2020) na ASL-LEX (Caselli et al., 2016), masuala yametokea yanayohitaji kurekebisha namna utaratibu wa kifolojia na makundi yanavyotumiwa na hata kuamua kutekelezwa, na itakayotofautisha tofauti za kimaadili kwa lugha za heshima. Gazeti hilo linahitimisha kwa kutafuta uwekezaji wa mahusiano ya nadharia-hadi database. Mifano imepewa kutokana na matatizo ya nadharia na maswali ya utafiti yanayotokana na matokeo ya jengo la rasilimali za lugha. Hizi zinaonyeshwa kama ushahidi kwamba sio tu shirika la nadharia la taarifa za taarifa bali kwamba mchakato wa uumbaji wa database unaweza pia kuelezea nadharia zetu.

paper.abstract_hr: Razvoj potpisanih jezičkih leksičkih baza podataka, digitalnih organizacija koji opisuju različite fonološke znakove i pokušaja utvrđivanja odnosa između znakova dovelo je do obnovljenog interesa o fonološkim opisima koji se koriste za jedinstveno identificiranje i organizaciju leksikona odgovarajućih jezika znakova (van der Kooij, 2002; Fenlon et al., 2016; Brentari et al., 2018). Kroz međusobno zajednički proces kodiranja uključen u organizaciju dvije leksičke baze podataka, ASL Signbank (Hochgesang, Crasborn i Lillo-Martin, 2020) i ASL-LEX (Caselli et al., 2016), došlo je do pitanja koje zahtijevaju pregledati kako se primjenjuju fonološke funkcije i kategorije i čak odlučuju, a koje bi odgovarajući različiti leksički kontrast za odgovarajuće jezike znaka. Papir zaključuje istraživanjem obrnutog odnosa teorije na bazu podataka. Primjeri su dato teorijskih posljedica i pitanja istraživanja koje prouzrokuju posljedice izgradnje jezičkih resursa. To su predstavljene kao dokaz da ne samo teorija utječe na organizaciju baza podataka nego da proces stvaranja baze podataka također može obavijestiti naše teorije.
paper.abstract_af: Die ontwikkeling van getekende taal leksiese databasis, digitale organisasies wat verskillende fonologiese funksies van en probeer om verwantings tussen tekens te stel het resultaat in 'n hernuwe belang in die fonologiese beskrywings gebruik word om die leksies van respektiewe tekens tale te identifiseer en organiseer (van der Kooij, 2002; Fenlon et al., 2016; Brentari et al., 2018). Deur die gemeenskaplik gedeelde koderingsproses wat in die organisasie van twee leksiese databases, ASL Signbank (Hochgesang, Crasborn en Lillo-Martin, 2020) en ASL-LEX (Caselli et al., 2016) aangekom het probleme wat nodig om hersiening te doen hoe fonologiese funksies en kategories gebruik moet word en selfs besluit op te word, en wat sal adequate tekenskaplike kontras vir respektiewe tekenstales uitvee. Die papier sluit deur die omgekeerde van die teorie-na-databasis verhouding te ondersoek. Voorbeelde word gegee van teorieese inplikasies en ondersoek vrae wat uit die gevolge van taal hulpbron gebou word. Hierdie word voorgeskryf as bevestig dat nie net teoriee effekteer organisasie van databasis nie, maar dat die proses van databasis skepping ook ons teoriee kan inligtig.

paper.abstract_sq: Zhvillimi i bazave të dhënash lexike gjuhësh të nënshkruara, organizatave dixhitale që përshkruajnë karakteristika fonologjike të ndryshme dhe përpiqen të krijojnë marrëdhënie midis shenjave ka rezultuar në një interes të rinovuar në përshkrimin fonologjik të përdorur për të identifikuar dhe organizuar unikisht lexikonet e gjuhëve të shenjave respektive (van der Kooij, 2002; Fenlon et al., 2016; Brentari et al., 2018). Gjatë procesit të kodimit të përbashkët të përfshirë në organizimin e dy bazave të dhënash lexike, ASL Signbank (Hochgesang, Crasborn dhe Lillo-Martin, 2020) dhe ASL-LEX (Caselli et al., 2016), janë ngritur çështje që kërkojnë rishikimin e mënyrës se si funksionet dhe kategoritë fonologjike do të aplikohen dhe madje do të vendosen për të dhe që do të dallojnë në mënyrë të përshtatshme kontrastin lexik për gjuhët e sinjaleve respektive. Gazeta përfundon duke eksploruar kundërshtimin e marrëdhënieve teori-me-bazë të dhënave. Shembuj janë dhënë të pasojave teorike dhe pyetjeve kërkimore që rezultojnë nga pasojat e ndërtimit të burimeve gjuhësore. Këto paraqiten si prova që jo vetëm teoria ndikon në organizatën e bazave të të dhënave por edhe procesi i krijimit të bazave të dhënave mund të informojë teoritë tona.

paper.abstract_bn: স্বাক্ষরিত ভাষা লেক্সিক্যাল ডেটাবেস, ডিজিটাল সংস্থা যারা বিভিন্ন ফোলোজিক্যাল বৈশিষ্ট্যের বিষয়বস্তু বর্ণনা করে এবং প্রচেষ্টা করার চেষ্টা করছে তারা বিভিন্ন স্বাক্ষরিত ভাষার লেক্সিকান ভাষা দুটি লেক্সিকাল ডেটাবেস, এসএল সিগন্ব্যাংক (হোচেজেগান, ক্রাসজন এবং লিলো-মার্টিন, ২০২০২০) এবং এস্লি-লেক্স (ক্যাসেলি এল, ২০১৬) প্রক্রিয়া প্রক্রিয়ার মাধ্যমে প্রক্রিয়া প্রক্রিয়ার মাধ্যমে পুনরায় বিষয়গুলো প্রকাশ করা হয়েছে য এই কাগজটি শেষ হয়েছে তত্ত্ব থেকে ডাটাবেস সম্পর্কের বিনিয়োগ বিনিয়োগের মাধ্যমে। তাদের উদাহরণ প্রদান করা হয়েছে যেগুলো ভাষার সম্পদ ভবনের ফলে থাকে। এগুলো প্রমাণ হিসেবে উপস্থিত করা হয়েছে যে শুধুমাত্র তত্ত্বাবজের প্রভাবের সংগঠন নেই, কিন্তু ডাটাবেস সৃষ্টির প্
paper.abstract_ca: El desenvolupament de bases de dades lècsiques de llenguatges signades, organitzacions digitals que descriuen diferents característiques fonològics i intenten establir relacions entre senyals ha provocat un interès renovat en les descripcions fonològices utilitzades per identificar i organitzar únicament els lexicòns de les respectives llengües de senyals (van der Kooij, 2002; Fenlon et al., 2016; Brentari et al., 2018). Throughout the mutually shared coding process involved in organizing two lexical databases, ASL Signbank (Hochgesang, Crasborn and Lillo-Martin, 2020) and ASL-LEX (Caselli et al., 2016), issues have arisen that require revisiting how phonological features and categories are to be applied and even decided upon, and which would adequately distinguish lexical contrast for respective sign languages. El paper conclueix explorant el contrari de la relació teoria-base de dades. Examples are given of theoretical implications and research questions that arise from consequences of language resource building. Aquestes són presentades com evidències que no només influeix en la teoria en l'organització de bases de dades, sinó que el procés de creació de bases de dades també pot informar les nostres teories.
paper.abstract_cs: Vývoj lexikálních databází znakového jazyka, digitálních organizací, které popisují různé fonologické rysy znaků a snaží se navázat vztahy mezi znaky, vedl k obnovenému zájmu o fonologické popisy používané k jednoznačné identifikaci a organizaci lexikonů příslušných znakových jazyků (van der Kooij, 2002; Fenlon et al., 2016; Brentari et al., 2018). Během vzájemně sdíleného procesu kódování zahrnujícího organizování dvou lexikálních databází ASL Signbank (Hochgesang, Crasborn a Lillo-Martin, 2020) a ASL-LEX (Caselli et al., 2016) vznikly problémy, které vyžadují znovu prozkoumat, jak mají být fonologické prvky a kategorie aplikovány a dokonce rozhodovány, a které by adekvátně rozlišovaly lexikální kontrast pro příslušné znakové jazyky. Článek zakončuje zkoumáním inverzního vztahu mezi teorií a databází. Jsou uvedeny příklady teoretických implikací a výzkumných otázek, které vyplývají z důsledků budování jazykových zdrojů. Ty jsou prezentovány jako důkaz, že nejen teorie ovlivňuje organizaci databází, ale že proces tvorby databází může také informovat naše teorie.
paper.abstract_fi: Viittomakielen leksikonien tietokantojen, merkkien erilaisia fonologisia piirteitä kuvaavien digitaalisten organisaatioiden ja niiden välisiä suhteita kuvaavien digitaalisten organisaatioiden kehittäminen on lisännyt kiinnostusta kunkin viittomakielen leksikonien yksilölliseen tunnistamiseen ja organisointiin käytettäviin fonologisiin kuvauksiin (van der Kooij, 2002; Fenlon et al., 2016; Brentari et al., 2018). Kahden leksikaalisen tietokannan, ASL Signbankin (Hochgesang, Crasborn ja Lillo-Martin, 2020) ja ASL-LEX (Caselli et al., 2016), organisoinnissa on ilmennyt ongelmia, jotka edellyttävät fonologisten ominaisuuksien ja luokkien soveltamista ja jopa päättämistä, ja jotka erottaisivat riittävän hyvin kunkin viittomakielen leksikaalisen kontrastin. Työn päätteeksi tutkitaan teorian ja tietokannan välisen suhteen käänteisyyttä. Esimerkkejä on teoreettisista vaikutuksista ja tutkimuskysymyksistä, jotka syntyvät kieliresurssien kehittämisen seurauksista. Nämä esitetään todisteena siitä, että teorialla ei ole vain vaikutusta tietokantojen organisointiin, vaan että tietokannan luontiprosessi voi myös vaikuttaa teorioihimme.
paper.abstract_et: Viipekeele leksikaalsete andmebaaside, digitaalsete organisatsioonide, mis kirjeldavad erinevaid fonoloogilisi tunnuseid ja püüavad luua seoseid märkide vahel, arendamine on toonud kaasa uue huvi fonoloogiliste kirjelduste vastu, mida kasutatakse vastavate viipekeelte leksikonide unikaalseks tuvastamiseks ja korraldamiseks (van der Kooij, 2002; Fenlon jt., 2016; Brentari jt., 2018). Kahe leksikaalse andmebaasi, ASL Signbank (Hochgesang, Crasborn ja Lillo-Martin, 2020) ja ASL-LEX (Caselli jt., 2016), korraldamisega seotud vastastikku jagatud kodeerimisprotsessi käigus on tekkinud probleeme, mis nõuavad fonoloogiliste tunnuste ja kategooriate rakendamist ja isegi otsustamist ning mis eristaksid piisavalt leksikaalset kontrasti vastavate viipekeelte puhul. Töö lõpetuseks uurib teooria-andmebaasi seose pöördpunkti. Esitatakse näiteid teoreetilistest tagajärgedest ja uurimisküsimustest, mis tulenevad keeleressursside loomise tagajärgedest. Need on esitatud tõenditena, et mitte ainult teooria ei mõjuta andmebaaside korraldust, vaid et andmebaasi loomise protsess võib ka meie teooriaid.
paper.abstract_ha: Kibuɗe danna na cikin harshen leksisi, digitali organisations waɗand a ke describe wasu folojical feature of and jarraba su daidaita haɗuwa a tsakanin ayukan ayukan sun ƙara wata rabo na gane wa fassarar folojical da aka yi amfani da shi unique in gane da organize leksisions of respective languages (van der Koij, 2002; Fenlon et, al., 2016; Brentari et al., 2018). Ga bayan jarrabin kodin da suka yi rabo da su haɗa danne biyu na littafin leksisi, AsL Signobanki (Hochgesang, Krasborn da Lillo-martin, 2020) da ANL-LEX (caseli et al., 2016), an sami masu buƙata yin kure da jinsi za'a karɓi wasu fasihai na folojical da kategori ko kuma za'a zãɓe su, kuma za ta rarraba tsakanin leksisi mai adequate wa zane-zane-zane-zane. Gauransa na ƙara bayani da ya sami musamman danne-danne-teori-zuwa-database. An buga misãlai daga masu husũma na littafin da masu tambayar tafiti waɗanda ke ƙarami daga ƙarshen gidan lugha. Wannan za'a ba da shaidar a cewa, ba zai iya ƙididdige shirin danne-danne ne kawai, kuma amma an faɗin zartar da danne-danne-danne, za'a iya sanar da fikorinmu.
paper.abstract_sk: Razvoj leksikalnih baz podatkov znakovnega jezika, digitalnih organizacij, ki opisujejo različne fonološke značilnosti in poskušajo vzpostaviti odnose med znaki, je povzročil ponovno zanimanje za fonološke opise, ki se uporabljajo za edinstveno identifikacijo in organiziranje leksikonov posameznih znakovnih jezikov (van der Kooij, 2002; Fenlon et al., 2016; Brentari et al., 2018). V procesu medsebojno deljenega kodiranja, vključenem v organizacijo dveh leksikalnih baz podatkov, ASL Signbank (Hochgesang, Crasborn in Lillo-Martin, 2020) in ASL-LEX (Caselli et al., 2016), so se pojavila vprašanja, ki zahtevajo ponovno pregled uporabe fonoloških značilnosti in kategorij ter celo odločanje o njih ter ki bi ustrezno razlikovali leksikalni kontrast za posamezne znakovne jezike. Prispevek zaključuje z raziskovanjem inverzne razmerje med teorijo in bazo podatkov. Podani so primeri teoretičnih posledic in raziskovalnih vprašanj, ki nastanejo zaradi posledic gradnje jezikovnih virov. Te so predstavljene kot dokaz, da teorija ne vpliva le na organizacijo baz podatkov, ampak da lahko proces ustvarjanja baz podatkov temelji tudi na naših teorijah.
paper.abstract_bo: The development of signed language lexical databases, digital organizations that describe different phonological features of and attempt to establish relationships between signs has resulted in a renewed interest in the phonological descriptions used to uniquely identify and organize the lexicons of respective sign languages (van der Kooij, 2002; Fenlon et al., 2016; Brentari et al., 2018). paper.abstract_he: הפיתוח של בסיסי נתונים לקסיים לשפה חתומים, ארגונים דיגיטליים שמתארים תכונות פונולוגיות שונות של ולנסות להקים מערכות יחסים בין סימנים הוביל לתעניין מחדש בתיאורים פונולוגיים שמשתמשים לזהות ולארגן באופן מיוחד את הלקסיקונים של שפות סימנים (van der Kooij, 2002; Fenlon et al., 2016; Brentari et al., 2018). במהלך תהליך הקוד המשותף ביחד שמעורב בארגון שני בסיסי נתונים לקסיים, ASL Signbank (Hochgesang, Crasborn and Lillo-Martin, 2020) ו ASL-LEX (Caselli et al., 2016), נוצרו בעיות שדורשות שיבוש איך תכונות וקטגוריות פונולוגיות אמורים להיות משתמשים ואפילו החליטו עליהם, ואפילו שיבין בהתאם את ההתנגדות לקסית לשפות הסימנים המתאימות. העיתון מסתיים על ידי לחקור את ההפך של מערכת היחסים תיאורית לבסיס הנתונים. דוגמאות נותנות של השלכות תיאורטיות ושאלות מחקר שנוצרות מההשלכות של בניית משאבי שפה. אלה מוציאים כהוכחה שלא רק שהתאוריה משפיעה בארגון של בסיסי נתונים, אלא שהתהליך של יצירת מסד נתונים יכול גם להודיע לתיאוריות שלנו.

paper.title: Measuring Lexical Similarity across Sign Languages in Global SignbankGlobal Signbank
paper.abstract: Lexicostatistics is the main method used in previous work measuring linguistic distances between sign languages. As a method, it disregards any possible structural / grammatical similarity, instead focusing exclusively on lexical items, but it is time consuming as it requires some comparable phonological coding (i.e. form description) as well as concept matching (i.e. meaning description) of signs across the sign languages to be compared. In this paper, we present a novel approach for measuring lexical similarity across any two sign languages using the Global Signbank platform, a lexical database of uniformly coded signs. The method involves a feature-by-feature comparison of all matched phonological features. This method can be used in two distinct ways : 1) automatically comparing the amount of lexical overlap between two sign languages (with a more detailed feature-description than previous lexicostatistical methods) ; 2) finding exact form-matches across languages that are either matched or mismatched in meaning (i.e. true or false friends). We show the feasability of this method by comparing three languages (datasets) in Global Signbank, and are currently expanding both the size of these three as well as the total number of datasets.

paper.title: PE2LGP Animator : A Tool To Animate A Portuguese Sign Language AvatarPE2LGP Animator: A Tool To Animate A Portuguese Sign Language Avatar
paper.abstract: Software for the production of sign languages is much less common than for spoken languages. Such software usually relies on 3D humanoid avatars to produce signs which, inevitably, necessitates the use of animation. One barrier to the use of popular animation tools is their complexity and steep learning curve, which can be hard to master for inexperienced users. Here, we present PE2LGP, an authoring system that features a 3D avatar that signs Portuguese Sign Language. Our Animator is designed specifically to craft sign language animations using a key frame method, and is meant to be easy to use and learn to users without animation skills. We conducted a preliminary evaluation of the Animator, where we animated seven Portuguese Sign Language sentences and asked four sign language users to evaluate their quality. This evaluation revealed that the system, in spite of its simplicity, is indeed capable of producing comprehensible messages.

paper.title: Translating an Aesop’s Fable to Filipino Sign Language through 3D AnimationAesop’s Fable to Filipino Sign Language through 3D Animation
paper.abstract: According to the National Statistics Office (2003) in the 2000 Population Census, the deaf community in the Philippines numbered to about 121,000 deaf and hard of hearing Filipinos. Deaf and hard of hearing Filipinos in these communities use the Filipino Sign Language (FSL) as the main method of manual communication. Deaf and hard of hearing children experience difficulty in developing reading and writing skills through traditional methods of teaching used primarily for hearing children. This study aims to translate an Aesop’s fable to Filipino Sign Language with the use of 3D animation resulting to a video output. The video created contains a 3D animated avatar performing the sign translations to FSL (mainly focusing on hand gestures which includes hand shape, palm orientation, location, and movement) on screen beside their English text equivalent and related images. The final output was then evaluated by FSL deaf signers. Evaluation results showed that the final output can potentially be used as a learning material. In order to make it more effective as a learning material, it is very important to consider the animation’s appearance, speed, naturalness, and accuracy. In this paper, the common action units were also listed for easier construction of animations of the signs.

paper.title: Elicitation and Corpus of Spontaneous Sign Language Discourse Representation Diagrams
paper.abstract: While Sign Languages have no standard written form, many signers do capture their language in some form of spontaneous graphical form. We list a few use cases (discourse preparation, deverbalising for translation, etc.) and give examples of diagrams. After hypothesising that they contain regular patterns of significant value, we propose to build a corpus of such productions. The main contribution of this paper is the specification of the elicitation protocol, explaining the variables that are likely to affect the diagrams collected. We conclude with a report on the current state of a collection following this protocol, and a few observations on the collected contents. A first prospect is the standardisation of a scheme to represent SL discourse in a way that would make them sharable. A subsequent longer-term prospect is for this scheme to be owned by users and with time be shaped into a script for their language.

paper.title: Signing as Input for a Dictionary Query : Matching Signs Based on Joint Positions of the Dominant Hand
paper.abstract: This study presents a new methodology to search sign language lexica, using a full sign as input for a query. Thus, a dictionary user can look up information about a sign by signing the sign to a webcam. The recorded sign is then compared to potential matching signs in the lexicon. As such, it provides a new way of searching sign language dictionaries to complement existing methods based on (spoken language) glosses or phonological features, like handshape or location. The method utilizes OpenPose to extract the body and finger joint positions. Dynamic Time Warping (DTW) is used to quantify the variation of the trajectory of the dominant hand and the average trajectories of the fingers. Ten people with various degrees of sign language proficiency have participated in this study. Each subject viewed a set of 20 signs from the newly compiled Ghanaian sign language lexicon and was asked to replicate the signs. The results show that DTW can predict the matching sign with 87 % and 74 % accuracy at the Top-10 and Top-5 ranking level respectively by using only the trajectory of the dominant hand. Additionally, more proficient signers obtain 90 % accuracy at the Top-10 ranking. The methodology has the potential to be used also as a variation measurement tool to quantify the difference in signing between different signers or sign languages in general.

paper.title: An Isolated-Signing RGBD Dataset of 100 American Sign Language Signs Produced by Fluent ASL SignersRGBD Dataset of 100 American Sign Language Signs Produced by Fluent ASL Signers
paper.abstract: We have collected a new dataset consisting of color and depth videos of fluent American Sign Language (ASL) signers performing sequences of 100 ASL signs from a Kinect v2 sensor. This directed dataset had originally been collected as part of an ongoing collaborative project, to aid in the development of a sign-recognition system for identifying occurrences of these 100 signs in video. The set of words consist of vocabulary items that would commonly be learned in a first-year ASL course offered at a university, although the specific set of signs selected for inclusion in the dataset had been motivated by project-related factors. Given increasing interest among sign-recognition and other computer-vision researchers in red-green-blue-depth (RBGD) video, we release this dataset for use by the research community. In addition to the RGB video files, we share depth and HD face data as well as additional features of face, hands, and body produced through post-processing of this data.

paper.title: Sign Language Motion Capture Dataset for Data-driven Synthesis
paper.abstract: This paper presents a new 3D motion capture dataset of Czech Sign Language (CSE). Its main purpose is to provide the data for further analysis and data-based automatic synthesis of CSE utterances. The content of the data in the given limited domain of weather forecasts was carefully selected by the CSE linguists to provide the necessary utterances needed to produce any new weather forecast. The dataset was recorded using the state-of-the-art motion capture (MoCap) technology to provide the most precise trajectories of the motion. In general, MoCap is a device capable of accurate recording of motion directly in 3D space. The data contains trajectories of body, arms, hands and face markers recorded at once to provide consistent data without the need for the time alignment.

paper.title: Recognition of Static Features in Sign Language Using Key-Points
paper.abstract: In this paper we report on a research effort focusing on recognition of static features of sign formation in single sign videos. Three sequential models have been developed for handshape, palm orientation and location of sign formation respectively, which make use of key-points extracted via OpenPose software. The models have been applied to a Danish and a Greek Sign Language dataset, providing results around 96 %. Moreover, during the reported research, a method has been developed for identifying the time-frame of real signing in the video, which allows to ignore transition frames during sign recognition processing.

paper.title: Machine Learning for Enhancing Dementia Screening in Ageing Deaf Signers of British Sign LanguageBritish Sign Language
paper.abstract: Ageing trend in populations is correlated with increased prevalence of acquired cognitive impairments such as dementia. Although there is no cure for dementia, a timely diagnosis helps in obtaining necessary support and appropriate medication. With this in mind, researchers are working urgently to develop effective technological tools that can help doctors undertake early identification of cognitive disorder. In this paper, we introduce an automatic dementia screening system for ageing Deaf signers of British Sign Language (BSL), using Convolutional Neural Networks (CNN), by analysing the sign space envelope and facial expression of BSL signers using normal 2D videos from BSL corpus. Our approach firstly establishes an accurate real-time hand trajectory tracking model together with a real-time landmark facial motion analysis model to identify differences in sign space envelope and facial movement as the keys to identifying language changes associated with dementia. Based on the differences in patterns obtained from facial and trajectory motion data, CNN models (ResNet50 / VGG16) are fine-tuned using Keras deep learning models to incrementally identify and improve dementia recognition rates. We report the results for two methods using different modalities (sign trajectory and facial motion), together with the performance comparisons between different deep learning CNN models in ResNet50 and VGG16. The experiments show the effectiveness of our deep learning based approach in terms of sign space tracking, facial motion tracking and early stage dementia performance assessment tasks. The results are validated against cognitive assessment scores as of our ground truth data with a test set performance of 87.88 %.

paper.title: Machine Translation from Spoken Language to Sign Language using Pre-trained Language Model as Encoder
paper.abstract: Sign language is the first language for those who were born deaf or lost their hearing in early childhood, so such individuals require services provided with sign language. To achieve flexible open-domain services with sign language, machine translations into sign language are needed. Machine translations generally require large-scale training corpora, but there are only small corpora for sign language. To overcome this data-shortage scenario, we developed a method that involves using a pre-trained language model of spoken language as the initial model of the encoder of the machine translation model. We evaluated our method by comparing it to baseline methods, including phrase-based machine translation, using only 130,000 phrase pairs of training data. Our method outperformed the baseline method, and we found that one of the reasons of translation error is from pointing, which is a special feature used in sign language. We also conducted trials to improve the translation quality for pointing. The results are somewhat disappointing, so we believe that there is still room for improving translation quality, especially for pointing.

paper.title: Automatic Classification of Handshapes in Russian Sign LanguageRussian Sign Language
paper.abstract: Handshapes are one of the basic parameters of signs, and any phonological or phonetic analysis of a sign language must account for handshapes. Many sign languages have been carefully analysed by sign language linguists to create handshape inventories. This has theoretical implications, but also applied use, as it is important due to the need of generating corpora for sign languages that can be searched, filtered, sorted by different sign components (such as handshapes, orientation, location, movement, etc.). However, it is a very time-consuming process, thus only a handful of sign languages have such inventories. This work proposes a process of automatically generating such inventories for sign languages by applying automatic hand detection, cropping, and clustering techniques. We applied our proposed method to a commonly used resource : the Spreadthesign online dictionary (www.spreadthesign.com), in particular to Russian Sign Language (RSL). We then manually verified the data to be able to perform classification. Thus, the proposed pipeline can serve as an alternative approach to manual annotation, and can help linguists in answering numerous research questions in relation to handshape frequencies in sign languages.

paper.title: BosphorusSign22k Sign Language Recognition DatasetBosphorusSign22k Sign Language Recognition Dataset
paper.abstract: Sign Language Recognition is a challenging research domain. It has recently seen several advancements with the increased availability of data. In this paper, we introduce the BosphorusSign22k, a publicly available large scale sign language dataset aimed at computer vision, video recognition and deep learning research communities. The primary objective of this dataset is to serve as a new benchmark in Turkish Sign Language Recognition for its vast lexicon, the high number of repetitions by native signers, high recording quality, and the unique syntactic properties of the signs it encompasses. We also provide state-of-the-art human pose estimates to encourage other tasks such as Sign Language Production. We survey other publicly available datasets and expand on how BosphorusSign22k can contribute to future research that is being made possible through the widespread availability of similar Sign Language resources. We have conducted extensive experiments and present baseline results to underpin future research on our dataset.

paper.title: Video-to-HamNoSys Automated Annotation SystemHamNoSys Automated Annotation System
paper.abstract: The Hamburg Notation System (HamNoSys) was developed for movement annotation of any sign language (SL) and can be used to produce signing animations for a virtual avatar with the JASigning platform. This provides the potential to use HamNoSys, i.e., strings of characters, as a representation of an SL corpus instead of video material. Processing strings of characters instead of images can significantly contribute to sign language research. However, the complexity of HamNoSys makes it difficult to annotate without a lot of time and effort. Therefore annotation has to be automatized. This work proposes a conceptually new approach to this problem. It includes a new tree representation of the HamNoSys grammar that serves as a basis for the generation of grammatical training data and classification of complex movements using machine learning. Our automatic annotation system relies on HamNoSys grammar structure and can potentially be used on already existing SL corpora. It is retrainable for specific settings such as camera angles, speed, and gestures. Our approach is conceptually different from other SL recognition solutions and offers a developed methodology for future research.

paper.title: Cross-Lingual Keyword Search for Sign Language
paper.abstract: Sign language research most often relies on exhaustively annotated and segmented data, which is scarce even for the most studied sign languages. However, parallel corpora consisting of sign language interpreting are rarely explored. By utilizing such data for the task of keyword search, this work aims to enable information retrieval from sign language with the queries from the translated written language. With the written language translations as labels, we train a weakly supervised keyword search model for sign language and further improve the retrieval performance with two context modeling strategies. In our experiments, we compare the gloss retrieval and cross language retrieval performance on RWTH-PHOENIX-Weather 2014 T dataset.
